meta.description: A three-story library with wooden floors.

system_prompt_anchors.sensory_description: Echo Archives stands as a quiet refuge of polished wood and filtered sunlight. The three-story interior is lined with tall shelves and iron-railed balconies overlooking the central reading floor. Wooden boards creak softly beneath careful footsteps. The scent of aged paper and varnish lingers in the air. Morning light spills through high windows in long golden beams; afternoon feels steady and focused; evening softens into warm lamplight and hushed shadows between the stacks.
system_prompt_anchors.crowd_atmosphere: Morning (06-12) draws early readers, researchers, and students seeking solitude. Afternoon (12-18) becomes studious and steady — soft keyboard tapping, quiet page turns, low murmurs at shared tables. Evening (18-22) feels contemplative and intimate, with fewer visitors lingering longer in silence. The atmosphere consistently encourages patience, thoughtfulness, and emotional grounding.
activities: Browse physical books and archived city records.
Use quiet reading tables for focused work or reflection.
Access public data terminals on the second floor.
Attend small lectures or author readings in the side hall.
Study architectural blueprints or historical maps of Link City.
system_prompt_anchors.interaction_rules: Privacy Level: Public. Maintain quiet decorum; disruptive behavior is discouraged.

seasonal_variations.frostlink: The library becomes a warm refuge for readers. Winter light through high windows creates beautiful patterns on the wooden floors.
seasonal_variations.surgespring: Spring brings renewed interest in research and learning. The library hosts more lectures and workshops celebrating renewal.
seasonal_variations.burnseason: The library's climate control makes it a popular heat refuge. Summer reading programs draw crowds seeking cool, quiet spaces.
seasonal_variations.shadowfall: Autumn creates the perfect library atmosphere. Amber light, contemplative mood, and falling leaves outside enhance the studious environment.

weather_variations.snow_heavy: The library is packed with people seeking shelter and warmth. The quiet atmosphere becomes even more cozy and intimate.
weather_variations.thunderstorm: Rain on the roof creates a soothing backdrop for reading. The storm makes the library feel like a peaceful sanctuary.
weather_variations.heatwave: The library is absolutely packed with heat-refugees. Reading tables fill quickly as people seek cool, quiet refuge.
weather_variations.clear_cool: Perfect weather means lighter attendance, but those who come enjoy the peaceful atmosphere and beautiful natural light.

lore.history: Echo Archives predates much of modern Link City and was one of the first civic buildings constructed during the city’s early planning phase. Designed to preserve collective memory, it houses both traditional printed works and digitized municipal records. Over decades, it has quietly witnessed the city's transformation while remaining structurally and culturally constant.
lore.secrets: Certain archival terminals require elevated credentials and contain sealed municipal documents. A restricted third-floor collection reportedly stores early urban planning drafts that reveal abandoned districts and altered infrastructure routes. Some visitors claim the building’s acoustic design subtly dampens heightened emotional states, making it unusually difficult to argue within its walls.
